repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: Currently there is no way of getting the list of completion items that are actually put in the popupmenu. Which means completion providers have no way of knowing if a completion was exhausted.

Solution: Add a `pum_matches` key to `complete_info()` which contains the indices of items that are put in the popupmenu.

Ref: https://github.com/vim/vim/issues/10007

comment_data.body:
There is already an `items` field which is a "list of completion matches". The field `pum_items` then suggests that the value has the same structure as the `items`, which it does not (and rightfully so).

As the new field is more aligned with `selected` field, maybe `shown` is a better name? Using suggested `shown_idx` is also good, just does not fit as well here.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -796,6 +796,8 @@ complete_info([{what}])                                        *complete_info()*
 				dictionary containing the entries "word",
 				"abbr", "menu", "kind", "info" and "user_data".
 				See |complete-items|.
+		   pum_items	Indices of completion matches that are shown

comment_data.body:
> How about `pum_shown`?

Yep, also seems fine.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -796,6 +796,8 @@ complete_info([{what}])                                        *complete_info()*
 				dictionary containing the entries "word",
 				"abbr", "menu", "kind", "info" and "user_data".
 				See |complete-items|.
+		   pum_items	Indices of completion matches that are shown

@@ -796,6 +796,8 @@ complete_info([{what}])                                        *complete_info()*
 				dictionary containing the entries "word",
 				"abbr", "menu", "kind", "info" and "user_data".
 				See |complete-items|.
+		   pum_items	Indices of completion matches that are shown

comment_data.body: `shown` is probably a better name since `selected` is also related to PUM but doesn't have a `pum_` prefix
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -796,6 +796,8 @@ complete_info([{what}])                                        *complete_info()*
 				dictionary containing the entries "word",
 				"abbr", "menu", "kind", "info" and "user_data".
 				See |complete-items|.
+		   pum_items	Indices of completion matches that are shown

comment_data.body:
in parallel with the existing `pum_visible` and `pumvisible()`, seems like "visible" is the right name for this.

```suggestion
		   visible	Indices of completion matches that are shown
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -796,6 +796,8 @@ complete_info([{what}])                                        *complete_info()*
 				dictionary containing the entries "word",
 				"abbr", "menu", "kind", "info" and "user_data".
 				See |complete-items|.
+		   shown	Indices of completion matches that are shown

comment_regular_data.body: don't get point. When there are no candidate words, that is when match_array is empty, the completechanged event will still be triggered ? idk why there need a new vvar ..complete_info also provide some infomations..

> don't get point. When there are no candidate words, that is when match_array is empty, the completechanged event will still be triggered ? idk why there need a new vvar ..complete_info also provide some infomations..

Yes but you still need to know if completion is exhausted or not, and what the completion items are. Currently there is no way of getting that. Also, look at https://github.com/vim/vim/issues/10007 to know why `complete_info()` is not enough

It seems that because the items of complete_info are all items, it cannot distinguish the candidate words displayed in the current pum. I implemented similar behavior locally in my completion plugin. Now the order of items will not be disrupted https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/27955 so you can easily infer the candidate words displayed in the current pum. can't simply add the current index in pum to items, for example the shown_idx field? This should be easier than adding a new vvar.
The name "visible" may also be ambiguous. If there are many matches, there will be a scrollbar and some matches are only shown after scrolling. Should those be considered "visible" or not?

> If there are many matches, there will be a scrollbar and some matches are only shown after scrolling. Should those be considered "visible" or not?

And that should be spelled out in the docs. I thought for sure that the purpose of this PR was to indicate which items are visible on the screen. What, then, is the purpose? (Say it in the docs, not to me)

> The name "visible" may also be ambiguous. If there are many matches, there will be a scrollbar and some matches are only shown after scrolling. Should those be considered "visible" or not?

True. Maybe "matched" then?

> > The name "visible" may also be ambiguous. If there are many matches, there will be a scrollbar and some matches are only shown after scrolling. Should those be considered "visible" or not?
> 
> True. Maybe "matched" then?

This doesn't work because completion items are called completion matches in several places in the documentation.

I feel like at the end of the day, `pum_items` probably makes the most amount of sense, or `pum_indices` or something that makes it clear that we're referring to popupmenu items. Maybe `pum_matches`?

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: feat(completion): add `pum_matches` key to `complete_info()`
